item.title: By: Ragnorok
item.dc:creator: Ragnorok
item.description: <p>- I'm using FireFox 1.0.6 for that very reason ... 1.5 is too flakey ... and 1.0.6 is rock solid. In my case, PrefBar won't install in 1.5, and I really like having that at my disposal. Sounds like I've avoided a whole rash of other issues as well.</p>
item.content:encoded: – I’m using FireFox 1.0.6 for that very reason … 1.5 is too flakey … and 1.0.6 is rock solid. In my case, PrefBar won’t install in 1.5, and I really like having that at my disposal. Sounds like I’ve avoided a whole rash of other issues as well.

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>I had thought it might be extensions so removed the few that I do use but no improvement unfortunately.<br/><br/><br/><br/>So for the moment I am using IE on my work PC. Luckily Firefox isn't exhibiting any problems on my PowerBook so I can still use it there.</p>
item.content:encoded:
I had thought it might be extensions so removed the few that I do use but no improvement unfortunately.

So for the moment I am using IE on my work PC. Luckily Firefox isn’t exhibiting any problems on my PowerBook so I can still use it there.

item.title: By: Laurette Rynne
item.dc:creator: Laurette Rynne
item.description: <p>I've noticed the same thing using Firefox 1.5. It's particularly bad with multiple tabs open, and is even doing weird things with the display of pages - sometimes they work, other times not.</p><p>I'm also toying with the idea of downgrading (1.07, not IE!), but haven't yet - I'm giving them a chance.</p><p>It's also possible that it's an extension which is causing the problem, not core Firefox code - could be why not everyone is experiencing the problem.</p>
item.content:encoded:
I’ve noticed the same thing using Firefox 1.5. It’s particularly bad with multiple tabs open, and is even doing weird things with the display of pages – sometimes they work, other times not.

I’m also toying with the idea of downgrading (1.07, not IE!), but haven’t yet – I’m giving them a chance.

It’s also possible that it’s an extension which is causing the problem, not core Firefox code – could be why not everyone is experiencing the problem.

item.title: By: Alison Theobald
item.dc:creator: Alison Theobald
item.description: <p>I'm still using 1.0.7 at work (with 3 tabbed home pages) & haven't experienced any real problems. One annoyance - we had a power cut a couple of days ago which completely corrupted my profile & I lost all bookmarks <a href="<a rel="nofollow" href="http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GHL/$FILE/sad.gif"" rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GHL/$FILE/sad.gif"</a> rel="nofollow"><a href="http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GHL/$FILE/sad.gif" rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GHL/$FILE/sad.gif</a></a><br/><img src="<a rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GHL/$FILE/sad.gif"</a>><br/>I know I should have had a backup (got one now!) but at least with IE I could have just copied them back from my favourites folder.</p>
item.content:encoded:
I’m still using 1.0.7 at work (with 3 tabbed home pages) & haven’t experienced any real problems. One annoyance – we had a power cut a couple of days ago which completely corrupted my profile & I lost all bookmarks http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GHL/$FILE/sad.gif“ rel=”nofollow”>http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GHL/$FILE/sad.gif
http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GHL/$FILE/sad.gif“>
I know I should have had a backup (got one now!) but at least with IE I could have just copied them back from my favourites folder.

item.title: By: Sean Burgess
item.dc:creator: Sean Burgess
item.description: <p>If you want to get a real kick, surf using firefox for a while and then look at the memory and virtual memory that it has tied up. Both Firefox and IE are far worse than Notes 6.5, but Firefix is really bad cause it won't release any memory it allocates until you restart the program.</p><p>Sean---</p>
item.content:encoded:
If you want to get a real kick, surf using firefox for a while and then look at the memory and virtual memory that it has tied up. Both Firefox and IE are far worse than Notes 6.5, but Firefix is really bad cause it won’t release any memory it allocates until you restart the program.

Sean—

item.title: By: Bob Obringer
item.dc:creator: Bob Obringer
item.description: <p>The only real problem I have noticed is when multiple windows are open. When I close one window... it takes a few seconds sometimes for the window underneath to become exposed and get focused.</p><p>Saw a blog entry by Ben Goodger yesterday that made me think this might be related to the HUGE increase in memory usage in 1.5 vs 1.0. This is not due to a leak but the way 1.5 caches pages across tabs... see here: <a href="<a rel="nofollow" href="http://weblogs.mozillazine.org/ben/archives/009749.html"" rel="nofollow ugc">http://weblogs.mozillazine.org/ben/archives/009749.html"</a> rel="nofollow"><a href="http://weblogs.mozillazine.org/ben/archives/009749.html" rel="nofollow ugc">http://weblogs.mozillazine.org/ben/archives/009749.html</a></a></p>
item.content:encoded:
The only real problem I have noticed is when multiple windows are open. When I close one window… it takes a few seconds sometimes for the window underneath to become exposed and get focused.

Saw a blog entry by Ben Goodger yesterday that made me think this might be related to the HUGE increase in memory usage in 1.5 vs 1.0. This is not due to a leak but the way 1.5 caches pages across tabs… see here: http://weblogs.mozillazine.org/ben/archives/009749.html“ rel=”nofollow”>http://weblogs.mozillazine.org/ben/archives/009749.html
